Maestro bi bil gotovo ponosen
02 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Lea Hedžet

Na velikem opernem prazniku, ki sta ga skupaj priredila Kulturno društvo Hrvatini in ansambel Opere in baleta SNG iz Ljubljane, je bil posvečen spominu na Vladimirja Koblerja, ki je nekaj let dirigiral tudi hrvatinskemu zboru.



Operni praznik sta skupaj priredila Kulturno društvo Hrvatini in ansambel Opere in baleta SNG iz Ljubljane. Foto: Miha Crnič

HRVATINI > Oder Kulturnega doma so prejšnji petek napolnili člani orkestra, prvaki in solisti ljubljanske opere. Pod taktirko Marka Hribernika so oblikovali prikupen program najbolj priljubljenih arij iz znanih oper 19. stoletja.
30 let kulturnega doma
Sopranistka Urška Arlič Gololičič, mezzosopranistka Nuška Drašček Rojko, tenorist Branko Robinšak, baritonist Jože Vidic in basist Peter Martinčič so ob spremljavi celotnega opernega orkestra očarali nabito polno dvorano hrvatinskega kulturnega doma, ki je ob tej priložnosti praznoval svojo 30-letnico. Za njegovo izgradnjo je bil zaslužen prav Vladimir Kobler, ki so se mu člani opernega ansambla in domačega kulturnega društva poklonili ob deseti obletnici njegove smrti.
Na koncert so povabili tudi nekaj pomembnih gostov in Koblerjevo družino. Vdova Smilja Černelč Kobler je bila iskreno hvaležna in navdušena nad prekrasnim večerom, polnim utrinkov iz Koblerjevega življenja in dela. Zelo živo se ga je spominjal tudi umetniški vodja in prvak ljubljanske Opere Branko Robinšak, ki je sicer že osvojil odre največjih evropskih opernih gledališč, a v Hrvatinih je tokrat pel prvič. In veliko mu je pomenilo, da prav ob tej priložnosti: “Svoj prvi angažma v tej operi sem dobil prav, ko je bil njen direktor Vladimir Kobler. Še zdaj imam doma pogodbo z njegovim podpisom. Bil je velik dirigent, ki je znal orkester voditi izjemno precizno, a obenem tudi zelo čustveno.”
Z anekdoto se mu je poklonil dirigent Marko Hribernik, ki je sicer premlad, da bi lahko s Koblerjem sodeloval, a se je spomnil pripovedovanja vdove, ki je pogosto s soprogom igrala klavir štiriročno, najraje intermezzo Viktorja Parme, ki ga je mladi dirigent zato uvrstil v petkov spored. O njem je slišal veliko dobrega: “Vsi so mi pripovedovali, kako velik muzik je bil, in kako je znal tenkočutno spremljati pevce. Zato mi je žal, da ni ohranjenih več njegovih posnetkov, ker bi se lahko mlajše generacije od njega še veliko naučile.”
Netopir, Pepelka ...
Več kot besede pa je številnim poslušalcem povedala glasba, ki jo je uvedla uvertura k Straussovi operi Netopir. Z neverjetno natančnostjo, a obenem lahkoto in glasovno mehkobo je izjemno zahtevno Rossinijevo arijo Pepelke zapela solistka Nuška Drašček Rojko, ki ji je sledil Peter Martinčič v priljubljeni ariji Bazilia iz Seviljskega brivca. Ena najtežjih sopranskih arij, Donizettijeva Lucia di Lamermoor, je v odlični izvedbi priznane solistke Urške Arlič Gololičič marsikomu vzela sapo. Če ne prej, se jim je povrnila ob odločnem in prodornem nastopu prvaka ljubljanske opere Jožeta Vidica v ariji Escamilla iz Bizetove opere Carmen ter v hudomušnem duetu Janka in Kecala ali bolje Petra Martinčiča in Branka Robinšaka iz Smetanove Prodane neveste. Izvrstna je bila tudi Robinšakova izvedba Giordanove arije Andree Chenierja, nad vsemi pa je zablestel Delibesov cvetlični duet Lakmé in Mallike, s katerim sta Urška Arlič Gololičič in Nuška Drašček Rojko dvorano zazibali v ritmu barkarole. Za radostne sklepne takte je poskrbel še domači zbor Adriatic, ki je skupaj z orkestrom in solisti zapel napitnico iz Verdijeve Traviate.
Maestro Kobler bi bil gotovo ponosen na “svoj” ansambel, ki je po zaslugi prizadevnih domačih organizatorjev tokrat zablestel v dvorani hrvatinskega kulturnega doma. 


Zapeli sta tudi mezzosopranistka Nuška Drašček Rojko (levo) in sopranistka Urška Arlič Gololičič. Foto: Miha Crnič
text:
Maestro would certainly be proud
02 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Lea Hedget

At a major opera festival, organized jointly by the Croatian Cultural Association and the Ljubljana Opera and Ballet Ensemble, he was dedicated to the memory of Vladimir Kobler, who also conducted the Croatian Choir for several years.



The opera holiday was jointly organized by the Hrvatini Cultural Society and the Ljubljana Opera and Ballet SNG. Photo: Miha Crnic

CROATIANS> The stage of the Cultural Center was filled with members of the orchestra, champions and soloists of the Ljubljana Opera last Friday. Under the tactics of Marko Hribernik, they designed a charming program of the most popular arias from famous operas of the 19th century.
30 years of cultural home
Co-soprano Urška Arlič Gololičič, mezzo-soprano Nuška Drašček Rojko, tenor Branko Robinšak, baritone player Jože Vidic and bassist Peter Martinčič enchanted the crowded hall of the Croatian Cultural Center, which celebrated its 30th anniversary, accompanied by the entire opera orchestra. Vladimir Kobler was responsible for its construction, which members of the opera ensemble and the National Cultural Society paid tribute to on the tenth anniversary of his death.
Some important guests and the Kobler family were also invited to the concert. The widow Smilja Černelč Kobler was sincerely grateful and delighted with the wonderful evening full of moments from Kobler's life and work. He was also remembered very vividly by the artistic director and champion of the Ljubljana Opera Branko Robinšak, who had already conquered the stages of the largest European opera theaters, but this time he sang for the first time. And it meant a lot to him, on this very occasion: “I got my first engagement in this opera when its director was Vladimir Kobler. I still have a contract signed with him at home. He was a great conductor who knew how to conduct the orchestra with great precision, but at the same time very emotionally. ”
Anecdote paid tribute to conductor Marko Hribernik, who was too young to co-operate with Kobler but remembered the story of a widow, who often played the piano four-handed with his spouse, most preferably the intermezzo of Viktor Parma, which was therefore listed by the young conductor. on Friday's schedule. He had heard a lot of good things about him. So I'm sorry to hear that no more of his footage is preserved, because the younger generations could learn a lot from him. "
Bat, Cinderella ...
More than a word, however, many listeners were told by the music introduced by the overture to Strauss's Bat Bat. With incredible precision, but at the same time light and soft, Rossi's aria Cinderella's extremely demanding aria was sung by soloist Nuška Drašček Rojko, followed by Peter Martinčič in the popular Bazilia aria from the Barber of Seville. One of the heaviest soprano arias, Donizetti's Lucia di Lamermoor, took a great breath in many excellent performances by renowned Urška soloist Arlič Gololičič. If not sooner, she returned to them with the decisive and penetrating performance of Ljubljana opera champion Joze Vidic in the aria Escamilla of Bizet's opera Carmen and in the feisty duet of Janko and Kecal or better Peter Martinčič and Branko Robinšak of Smetan's Sold Bride. Robinsak's performance of Andrea Chenier's Giordano aria was also outstanding, with Delibes' floral duet Lakmé and Mallike glittering above them, with Urška Arlič Gololičič and Nuška Drašček rocking the ballroom in the rhythm of the barcarole. The home choir of Adriatic, which together with the orchestra and soloists, sang a potion from Verdi's Traviata together with the orchestra and soloists, provided joyful concerts.
Maestro Kobler would surely be proud of his "own" ensemble, which this time, thanks to the hard work of local organizers, shone in the hall of the Croatian Cultural Center.


Also singing were mezzo-soprano Nuška Drašček Rojko (left) and soprano Urška Arlič Gololičič. Photo: Miha Crnic
